explanation: The clause only says that if a party expressly waives a breach, that waiver does not apply to earlier or later breaches and is not a continuing waiver. It does not state that a party’s mere failure or delay in enforcing a provision (i.e., in exercising its rights) will not constitute a waiver of that provision or any other provision, which is required by the rule.
rule: State that failure to enforce any provision of the NDA does not constitute a waiver of that provision or any other provision.
exampleLanguage: No failure or delay by either party in exercising any right, power, or privilege under this Agreement shall operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise thereof preclude any other or further exercise of any right, power, or privilege hereunder.
